description:
Solid, divey sports bar by union square. Got plenty of TVs all around the bar and one big screen at the end of the bar that plays the biggest game with game audio! When we were there, they were playing 4-5 diff games so everyone wins! Beers here are cheap: 6-7$ per or y'all can do pitchers. Order at the bar and find your own seat. Sometimes they're a little slow to clean so just ask the people around if a table with crap on it has been empty for awhile. 

Otherwise, a chill bar with no pretense that's great to watch the games at.
author: Will X.

description:
We were having drinks and snacks next door and decided to pop into Union Square Sports Bar. Peter L and I walked in on Friday, May 18th around 9:15pm. We managed to find two seats at the bar.

I'd been drinking everything under the sun the last three stops (beer, shot, wine, cocktails, etc), so I wanted to keep it chill. Just got a beer. I have no idea which beer, but I think I may have seen a light beer on draft and just picked that? (I've been feeling a little fluffy lately.) I believe Peter ended up with a jameson and ginger. Both drinks were fine. Standard for this type of bar.

The atmosphere itself is just your typical sports bar. Dark with TVs. There wasn't a game going on while we were here (at least I don't think there was), so it was pretty laid back that night. Peter and I were able to talk and slowly enjoy our drinks. The bartender was nice and attentive. Though we only stayed for one round, so we didn't really ask for much during the hour plus we were here.

Lots of TVs so a good option for catching a game.
author: Elena N.

description:
that older, caucasian woman with a dark hair every friday ( she work with anita) she is soo damn rude !!  she make people (aka customer) get their own drinks, 
she makes people ( aka...regulars) leave early than normal, even though their drinks is still being consume. Dont say thank you when given a tip.

*** A great bartender is the ability to make good drinks and the ability to MAINTAIN ( or make them keep coming) customer. She is NOT !! even a Illegal alien can do a better job than her......for way less pay !!

*** A tip is a reflection of your service and attitude, its a courtesy - not a mandatory ***


If that irish guy is reading this, ( the owner) fire her ass.
author: YelpIsExtortion N S.

description:
UNDER "Better" NEW MANAGEMENT
I didn't expect to see the new awesome faces and a few familiar ones but I'm still treated like family here. Union Square Sports Bar has that "Cheers" vibe to it with flat screen TVs everywhere. Good people Good drinks made well actually an everyone can see what their paying for, the drinks are finally CHEAP!!! So come check out your favorite sports your favorite teams an your favorite players at your new favorite sports bar Union Square Sports Bar!!!!
author: Rolin S.

description: Pretty dead but I have to flag down the bar tender every time I want a beer. Acts as if I'm bugging her. Never once asked "would you like another".   She's great though at making sure I'm charged for every beer though. That's one thing she's good at.
author: Mike R.

description: A bit shady, but still a decent place to grab a drink n watch a game.  While sitting inside by the window we had a long conversation with a woman who wanted money for food etc. not a big deal, but might bother some people.  The bartender n security guard were hanging out in the back.
author: Ondrea B.

description: Great to watch football  games, plenty of TVs. The service lacks though. Had to wait for over a half hour to receive a second beer.
author: S.J. I.

description: Great place to watch football.  Staff was friendly and turned TVs to whatever we wanted to watch.
author: LaDeene D.

description: This bar is on the same street as my place. There is a good looking thin blonde bartender. She is Rude. She is rude to me at least. So I am trying to take the edge off with a corona and tequila shot. Before you know it there was loud country music playing. I could be being sensitive but I think she wanted me a beautiful African American female to run out the bar. I did. Not because black people dont like country music. I left because I was there to catch a vibe not be depressed by her music selection. I mean it was Friday night.
author: Terina C.

description: This was a great place to watch the Mexico vs Germany game on Sunday 6/17/18. We were visiting San Francisco and stayed near by at Union Square and literally had no place to watch it at 7:30am other than in the hotel room. Luckily this sports bar was open and we had a great time. Beer was cold and the staff was friendly. Atmosphere was nice considering it was so early in the morning. We'd definitely go back when visiting San Francisco.
author: Diana R.

description: Came here before heading to the Warfield. Yelp users get cash back if you are part of that program...nice plus! Our bartender was super nice, she used to work at Warfield so she told us to get more beers here as they were cheaper....not a hard sell, more beer and less money...sign me up. Nice place, wasn't packed on a Wednesday night, but could be on weekend. I would definitely come back here before a show
author: Andrew M.

description:
I love the variety of beers. No waiter some days at week but it's ok.
Bluemoon, Prohibition, Samuel Adams and Lagunita are the best beers.
author: Karolina L.

description: Love this bar! Friendly, fun and attentive bartenders who are always welcoming. Great drinks and almost every sporting event is hosted. Thanks Nate & Anita-this is our neighborhood bar
author: Kyla G.

description: Hi we are from out of town n we stopped in for a quick drink and the bar tender oh my gosh she was so nice is quick to make you feel comfortable service is great we defiantly will return tomorrow she is the best defiantly made a friend Marina the best
author: Tammy P.

description:
Big 24 ounce beers, big... over 24 inch tv's sports memorabilia on the wall, memories at least 24 feet tall! San Fran is a city filled with a rich sports history, but if you don't have the bucks to spend on game day tickets, this might be a darn fine spot to watch a game with your buds, play some pool and drink a 24 ounce brew that does not cost a Major League budget to buy! 
In a vast see of bars, in downtown San Fran, you could easily watch a game in a new spot every day of the 162 game baseball season, but I garantee they all wont be as nice as this! 
Great service, decent selection, and did I mention 24 ounce beers!
I think this spot is up for an MVP award this year!
author: Patrick T.

description:
Happened to be in the city. Great night lots of fun . Warriors game... we happened to be walking around the city and wanted to sit down for a beer and this place was on the way. We came in and ordered beers. The service was dramatically poor and the welcoming sense of arrival was absolutely ridiculously bad. 

We started talking to other client and the way they actually treated was rude, unfair and with a high sense of criticism. So what happened to the SF friendly  community?? Where everybody looks out for everybody specially those that frequent a place.

I can say beer is beer and I will find it anywhere anytime...but for people like those two young female bartenders will never return to this place ever again.
author: Claudia D.

description:
Ambience was ok.. Screens were not clear.. Could have been better.

It was less crowded for NFL pre-season as well.
author: Ashok B.

description: This place is an absolute dump and poorly staffed.  Went there to watch NFL on a Thursday evening and they had one woman behind the bar and there must have been 40 people in the place.  They serve absolutely no food, not even potato chips or pretzels.  The bathrooms are disgusting.
author: Curls E.

description: I was looking for a place to drink by are hotel. Found this place on search engine . Customer service was good. Low selection of beers, but it did the joob. Don't look above your head, years of dust on decor & back bar lol!
author: Antoinette G.

description:
Stopped in as I was early for an appointment in the Flood Building on Market...glad I did. Prices are good, lots of TV's for sports, cute bartender, clean, friendly patrons, and nice atmosphere.
Hopefully I won't have too many before my psychotherapy appointment!

I'll rack a game of pool next week. Seems like a great place to get a drink that's not 18bux in this hood.
author: Enoch K.

description: Seven customers in the bar and it took the bartender 5 minutes to get to me. If you're going to tend bar you need to move faster than that. $15 for a pint and Jagar but all the trappings of a dive.
author: Mark L.

description:
Man steals knife from Tenderloin sports bar, slashes 2, cops say

http://www.sfgate.com/news/article/Man-steals-knife-from-Tenderloin-sports-bar-10818480.php

Seriously: You could walk into this bar strip naked, climb on a table and take a dump on it, go to the corner and piss into it, and the bartenders still wouldn't notice. So of course you could easily steal a knife and get away with no problemo.
author: Yowz A.

description: Good variety of beers. Nice music. Restroom is terrible though. There was no waiter and took some time to get a beer. Sometimes some of the TVs don't work properly.
author: Andres R.

description: The bar tender was very rude! We were here from out of town and looking to watch the game. We didn't know it wasn't a kid friendly place. The lady was yelling at us for our ID's when my brother was only 11. She never said kids aren't allowed just told us he needs to wait outside. The situation should have been handled differently then her being rude.
author: Jazzi S.

description:
All I can say is Texas A&M came from 13 down (10 down with 4 minutes to go) to beat Tennessee on the road, so that can't help but affect my impression of USSB, and this review. Whoop!

Anyway, it's a nice, relatively small, neighborhood sports bar, just where the FiDi starts getting seedy (it's probably technically in Tenderloin, but I'm not an expert on such things). Unfortunately, they opened on Saturday two hours later than their sign said they did. Anyway, good beer selection and pretty good bloody mary. The bartender (her first day, on loan from a bar nearby that was closed for renovation) was quick to switch not one but two TVs to the SEC channel for me (granted there was only one other guy there), but still, I appreciate that. Service was good and fast and the beer was cold, and the TVs all worked. That's about all you can ask of a sports bar.

They put on the Real Madrid game for one other guy there, so (early at least) they are happy to accommodate fans when possible.

I have no idea what it's like at USSB when it's crowded, so you are on your own with that. There's a couple of pool tables in the back and some iffy restrooms.
author: Greg M.

description:
I could follow the lead of others and label the Union Square Sports Bar a trendy hub of testosterone with mediocre drinks and service. Or, as one reviewer oddly describes it, a "predominately strange male environment." But that would be too easy. Sure, this isn't the standout in a neighborhood that is packed full of super unique bars with incredible cocktails, but what they do they do right, and that will keep me coming back. 

That "male environment" is most likely due to the 20+ flat screens that adorn the walls showing every sport imaginable. As the name so subtly implies, this is a sports bar. It's actually refreshing to find a sports bar near your hotel when the only other options in five square blocks are high-end cocktail bars or dives you could easily get shanked in. The service and the drinks aren't anything exceptional, but they do the trick when your main goal is to belly-up, grab a buzz and watch the game for a couple hours. 

This may not be everyone's cup of tea, and that is understandable. If you are looking for someplace comfortable and welcoming to escape, have a drink and take in a sport or two, this should be high on your list.
author: Alex L.

description: Dark & dirty but not in a good way. $11 for a short vodka & soda. Sketchy clientele. Lots of TVs but that's the only plus. There wasn't any music playing. Totally uninviting. Skip it.
author: Laura G.

description:
A Dirty Dive. 

Frito pies, beer, vodka sodas, and lots of TVs. That's really all you need to know about this place. It's also centrally located between the Tenderloin and tourist traps as far as the eye can see. 

Need a Frito Pie break? You've found the place.
author: Nate M.

description:
Stumbled upon this spot in between bars and in the moment didn't truly appreciate it for what it was. In hindsight this may have not been the best place for a quick drink, but as a place to come to watch a game with your guys - this is just the place. 

Picture if you will your ultimate man cave in your mind. Mine would be well stocked with lots of easy to drink nothing fancy booze varieties to start. It would be no frills but still look amazing with exposed brick, comfortable seats and token beer lights and beer schwag in the walls. It would have tons of TVs playing every game that's on that night. And pretty gals serving bar. 

This spot has it all! I didn't get a chance to try their pub grub, but I imagine they cover the bases reasonably well. 

If your visiting SF and are looking for a familiar place to catch your favorite team, I'd recommend stopping here.
author: Kris U.

description: ok.. our group of peeps moved to Harry Harrington's Bar and due to price hike for all drink by one buck - we are all moving to this bar.  We know the bar manager Brian and called and he is of course happy to have us.  We look forward to going there and drinking and playing pool watching games and the taco place is just down the street too.. so its all good!  WHOOT!
author: Gloria F.

description: This bar has changed within the last few months that doesn't seem to be a change for a good reason. I recently went back to the bar this week and noticed one of the bartenders that is short, blond hair with a ponytail has a real rude attitude. I wanted to understand why my henessesy shot was $10 which use to cost $8 and I bought my friend a long island which use to cost $9 however wd were charged $14!! This to me was ridiculous because there was no notice about a price increase and the bartender never gave an explaination which is unacceptable. After all these years, I never seen this in as many bars I've been in. Hopefully they change this remain the consistency they use to be. But for now on I rather go somewhere else.
author: Say F.

description:
Being in the restaurant industry, this was a place a few of us would come to for after work drinks before catching barts, muni's and busses. I would not step foot in this place if my life depended on it at this point. Let me remind you I WORK in san francisco, I am not some local you would expect to be targeted. Imagine being a tourist. 

1. This place attracts incredibly shifty people
2. The few times I did go in there I always had that nagging feeling something was off. 

Well, finally something bad did happen. While I had went to the restroom, my buddy was watching my bag that was on the floor between us. When I got back, I waved goodbye and left. It was only when I was on the bart that I discovered my wallet had been stolen from my backpack. I immediately called my friend and he said a guy  to his right had started talking to him. We both think this was intentionally done to distract him. 
I immediately went in the next day and spoke with the bartender. It was all a big song and dance that "noone had turned anything in". It was incredibly suspicious. 

It has now taken me two months of putting fraud alerts on accounts, replacing cards, getting a new drivers license, filing police reports, etc. I only had $10 dollars in the wallet as I keep my cash in a hidden pocket in the backpack, but it is the things that cannot be replaced. photos of my deceased sister, a quote from a best friend. Still makes me sick to think about it. 

I give this place negative 10 stars just for the sheer sketchy, dangerous aspect that is going on in here.
author: MissMimi L.

description:
The televisions are obscured by the taps If you are sitting at the bar. The one I am watching, with the 49er game on it, has closed captioning, even though the sound is on. It's very distracting. 

It took a while before anyone finally took my beer order and I had to finally get his attention to make it happen. They don't have food, except for nachos out of a machine on the counter.
author: Mike D.

description: Small place but packed with tvs and you can be sure to get your game on. The bartender was cool, too. It would be better if they served food, though, otherwise I would have given it 5 stars.
author: Marc H.

description: Prices are fair, lots of homeless people on the corner from the bar but it makes a nice easy joint to grab one.
author: M U.

description: Perfect sports bar for the area. Jen was our bartender, made a perfect bloody Mary. Drinks were fair priced and three best had a good amount people without feeling packed. Most importantly drinks were strong and came quickly.
author: Tyler S.

description:
Nice clean sports bar.

2 Pool Tables

10+ TVs to play any sports you want.

Cheap alcohol prices.

Definitely will be coming back.
author: Steven F.

description:
Smaller than it looks in the pictures, so just be aware of that if you have a mid size group.  Service was good, they don't have a kitchen, but allow you to bring food in and there are a bunch of places to order from.

Good line up of beer choices and lots of TVs.  Friendly fans of all the different teams so a good place to go to cheer on your favorites.
author: Terence P.

description:
Don't you just love today's technologies? 

With the invention of digital satellite television, you can get an endless amount of television programming.  

Especially most sports bars; now they can subscribe and program to any sporting events.   

Many of my followers know I am a huge NBA fan. My first visit after shopping I just walk by and saw an NBA game on the bar's huge screen. Now I know a bar in the area that also shows an NBA game.

Then, I came back on a weekend to hopefully watch a marquee NBA game on one of twenty televisions. But a large majority of the patrons were watching Pro and College football games. So basically watching an NBA game or any sporting events of your choice on one of the televisions is a challenge on the weekends. 

But I do like the large selections of brews on tap, including the Anchor Steam: California Lager...yum!

I would definitely come here again on a weeknight, where most NBA games are televise.
author: Matt G.

description: YES YES, this place is right off the Powell Bart and has a great bartender and a fun environment. We went there before outside lands to grab a couple shots and beers. Decent pricing but great bartender who clearly remembered his regulars. They had the olympics on about 4 tvs and a big tv to watch sports on. Highly recommend
author: Dominique W.

description:
Eh, it's okay. It's not terrible and it's not that great, it will do when you feel like having a beer and watching a game. The clientele are certainly interesting, they range from Financial District workers to workers who look like they came from a bar in West Virginia.

Great place to watch hockey thought, I had a good time.  The drinks were cheap and the bartenders were nice.
author: Patricia Patti P W.

description:
I came here with some friends to catch a pre season 49ers game. It's wasn't very crowded so the seats were easy to find. Tons of tvs, so definitely great for game days.  The service from Jessica was outstanding, she's great!

Only down fall was it was a warm day in the city and it was hotter in the bar than outside. Other than that, cool sports bar in an easy location.
author: Katherine E.

description: Cool bar, fantastic bartenders (no exceptions), good music and a great place to watch sports and meet the locals.
author: K K.

description: This bar will make you feel everybody knows your name! Real people, down to earth and good drinks!
author: Keo S.

description:
Came here on a Sunday night with some girlfriends to grab a quick beer after the Giants game. The doorman was rude when we accidentally walked in with water bottles, as if they were filled with liquor and we were being sneaky. Yeah sorry bud this is water and yes we will leave it at the front. 

Walked in and noticed it was really warm and humid in the bar. Not sure if they don't get good air flow inside or why it smells weird but wasn't planning on staying very long in the bar.

Its a predominately strange male environment. Ordered a beer and the pricing was reasonable. There were lots of TVs which was nice.  Looks like they do bar food specials but we didn't order any. 

Two pool tables were in the back where some sloppy drunks yelled obnoxiously through out the night. Not bad but it was overall an uncomfortable visit and wouldn't go again.
author: Danielle V.

description:
It was the Niners-Cardinals game, along with a whole host of other teams; I have no idea who that girl is, but she was holding the whole bar down all by herself.  Best server ever!!! Whoever owns/manages the bar should do everything to keep her from going to some other place.

The bar is spacious, the crowds were rooting for different teams, a happy bunch, but all well behaved. There were probably 12-16 TVs plastered all along the walls, on mute, with closed-captioning on, showing five (I think) different football games.

It was an afternoon well spent and, based on today's experience, I'd wholeheartedly recommend catching the games at this sports bar.
author: Umesh T.

description:
Here's what I enjoy in a sports bar....

-Solid draft selection
-Room to maneuver
-Attentive bartender 
-TV's at a decent viewing angle (how many places have 200 tv's all in terrible locations?)
-A seat at the bar

Simple, right? Thank you USSB for covering all these bases and more. Sat down here on a Sunday and chatted it up with the bartender while sipping on some Lagunitas lil' Sumpin's and watching the Yankees, PGA championship and pre-season NFL football.  I wasn't presented with a shite menu of fried goods to order (there is no kitchen) and I wasn't asked if I wanted an 'awesome Coors Light special'. In fact, the bartender and I ordered some bacon and eggs from the diner down the street and had a late breakfast in the bar. Love it. 

Be aware, this won't be your Gf's fave sports bar, but if you have some time to kill and are in the mood to watch a game, USSB fits the bill nicely.
author: Drew A.

description: I love to watch sports in bars and this would have gotten a better rating if all the TVs in the place worked, haha.  This is close to Union Station and the Bart.  I am not sure if it is a 49ers hang but we had a great time there last week.  Not my wife's hang but she is a good sport and likes to watch sports.
author: James D.

description:
Got a free promo shot of Kahlua Black, plus 2 SS shotglasses. Now time for Stella. 

This place has 20 flat screens, just off the heart of the Tenderloin. Mixed crowd of local fans, with the occasional tourist mixed in for lively competition. 2 small Pool tables in the rear. About 5 beers on tap, and pretty much anything else you want in drinks. But don't bring your lady here looking for foodie flavored mixed libations that have to be squeezed, pestle and mortared, and shaken.
author: Wanugee N.

description:
I came to San Francisco for a business conference and I visited USSB on a Monday. My experience Monday was great. I then attempted to visit the bar again on Wednesday. The bartender was different and proceeded to not serve me because my Oregon ID was not in their "book".

I am almost 24 years old and I spent over $75 there only two days before. Yet, they repay me by denying me service on my next visit. I will be visiting San Francisco many times for business and I will NEVER return to USSB.

Great job losing what should have been a valued customer.
author: Adam G.

description: Nice, chill place to watch a game. Usually they don't keep locals places like this close to tourist areas like Union Square, so I was happy to find it. Watched a couple playoff games here, not too crazy, beer prices super reasonable for San Francisco and service is friendly. Not a ton of food options: choices are hotdogs or nachos, but you can bring your own. Great bar!
author: Jeremy B.

description: The waitress is very mean and rude. She yelled at customers and doesn't care about their feelings.
author: Leo G.

description:
This is not a fancy place but is decent enough to enjoy drink and enjoy the game. The place though looks disorganized  when it comes to seating and it was hard to get the attention of the bartender while ordering drinks.

They don't serve food which is big minus point though they do allow people to bring own  food at the bar. Not the best spot but still deserves three stars in my book.
author: Vineet S.

description: Very nice staff. There was a girl bartender with pink/purple hair and she was very nice (sorry, didn't get your name.) Unfortunately, they were out of the first three beers that I ordered. Seating is hit or miss and very tight quarters. There are TV's for the sports. One large screen at the end of the room and some smaller units surrounding the bar (a bit too small though.) No food here, so don't come hungry. The doors were open the day that I was there on a 52 degree day. Quite cold inside. I would stop by for another beer, but it's difficult to make it a long stay kind of place.
author: J P.

description: Sitting here on the first nfl sunday of the year. They have one bartender a packed house and no support staff. It is also 100 degrees in the tiny room. This place could be great but im assuming they have terrible ownership and management.
author: Reid D.

description:
We were looking for a place to watch some of the nfl games before heading to the airport and came across this place. I will agree with others who have reviewed- it is hot in that place. The tables were dirty; we had to ask the waitress to wipe one down for us. Lots of tv's which was good and the waitress came right over and took our drink order. 

There was just no atmosphere and the staff just looked like they simply didn't care. The bartender was outside smoking and talking with friends more than half the time. He had on sweatpants that were hanging off his butt, showing his boxers, with a dirty white tshirt. I honestly kept thinking I was on that tv show "Bar Rescue", before Jon Tafer comes in and tells them how horrible it is.
author: Ashley S.

description: Pretty bad. The place is about 30 degrees warmer than it is outside. The waitress wouldn't allow me to open a tab, and kept turning my game to other channels. When I tried to ask her to turn it back, I couldn't get her attention to save my life. Do yourself a favor and walk a couple of blocks to Golden Gate tap room.
author: Carl X.

description:
I wanted to like this bar.  Quite simply, I had a few beers here on a few occasion's recently.

Bluntly - there was a pool off urine on the bathroom floor.  

Depending on the time of visit your server from earlier might be a patron, having an argument with the previous bartender you had earlier that same day.

You might also see the staff and some customers eating food...  well, burritos...  and as drunk as the former waitress from earlier might be, said burrito might end up on the floor of the entrance of the place....

There are other places to go.....
author: Dean P.

description: No real atmosphere - went to watch UVA game and Barcelona vs. Atletico. Had a few beers....which made me hungry....but they don't have a kitchen! No I will not eat the hotdogs they have or the nachos. I wanted real food.
author: Ron C.

description: This place is awesome! Brian, the manager, is a great guy. He suggested a few of his favorites and offered us a sample of something we hadn't heard of. He let me be a pain and have extra oranges with my shock top. Later, my friend needed a phone charge and Brian graciously let us borrow an Anker. We are from out of town and wandering into this cosy place has been our best move in sf all day. Cheers Brian! Thanks.
author: Jessica T.

description: Hidden gem of union square. Could not have picked a better place for a mid afternoon drink that turned into a spot we enjoyed during our whole trip in San Francisco. Brian was awesome and kudos to the owner of the bar for placing such a guy to run the bar. Everything was reasonably priced and the service was great. Will definitely be back, next time I am in town.
author: Andrew P.

description: Umm words can't explain.. All the drafts were out and the choices of beer were minimal.. It's a cheap place for drinks which is a good thing.. But overall I would pass by to another one if nearby.. I'm confused as well they have Spanish music in a sports bar..
author: John G.

description:
Reviewing from inside the bar. This review has been a long time coming, but it's well deserved. 

Everyone that works here is incredible and super friendly. They are fun and expert conversationalists to boot. 

If you want to watch a game, this is the place to go. Tons of tvs and they play all the sportz even the weird stuff, if you're into that. If you don't want to watch a game, this is the place to go. People are awesome, and they play whatever you want if games aren't in progress. 

Tldr:
Fun staff, fun atmosphere, beer, jukebox. What else could you want?
author: Grant L.

description:
Wandering amidst town, dreaming of a nice cold beer, comfy bar stool, and watching sports on several tv's? Wander no more and stop in to this gem of a sports bar!

With great services, tons of beers on tap, numerous tv's lining the entire bar, and pool tables in the back, it really does have just about everything you need for a sports bar! The prices are good, the servers are friendly, and they sure do pour a good drink! Cheers!
author: Akvile D.

description:
What can I say, it's a sports bar near Union Square. So it's called Union Square Sports Bar. I think I remember it bouncing around another location or two over the decades I've lived in town.

The crowd's a little varied, some jock and frat types, some random people, friends, visitors, locals. The bartenders and bouncer are friendly, particularly times when it's quiet. The beer and alcohol selection is normal for San Francisco, but if you come from anywhere else you might be amazed at all the microbrews.

Just a pleasant, unpretentious place where you might bring a friend, a non-fancy date, personally I just go there and surf the net on my computer after work. Nobody bothers me.
author: Gil S.

description:
Cheap. Ok beer selection.  Terrible, atrocious food. Lots of screens to watch sports on.

Overall, this place is pretty bad. 

While they have enough screens to be considered a good sports bar, they stop the ball when it comes to food. They have essentially nothing. Only really gross, disgusting, nacho-cheese-from-bag "nachos" and frozen hot dogs for five dollars! That is it. Nothing else. So if you want to watch a game and eat some food, you are out of luck at this place.

Their draft selection is above average. They have a good liquor selection. Drinks and beer are cheap. And I personally liked the fact they have pool tables. In addition, they do have a plethora of TVs. So you can at least be sure that you'll be able to watch whatever it is you want to watch.

To improve, they really need to improve their food selection and quality. Or make some deals with nearby restaurants to have them deliver to the bar.

Also their men's bathroom doesn't have a lock. So one cannot poop in peace.

I would not come here again.
author: Malcolm G.

description: Brian is a fantastic bartender. Great place. You'd be a fool to pass this place up. Great selection of beers and liqueurs. Right up the street from the Powell Street Station!!! A definite must.  Drop in. You won't be disappointed...I promise.  Ask him about his favorite tequila.
author: Shannon M.

description: $4 Bud/Bud light all day on a Sunday? Eh...I'll take it, I guess. I liked how many tv's this place had, plus it had a few pool tables inside as well. Was able to catch NCAA basketball and NBA simultaneously. Seems like they carry all the major sporting leagues, which is a plus. Backed bar seats is also always appreciated, so this place also gets some good marks from me. A good mix of local and out of towners. Good place to watch all the sports you can handle.
author: Dan M.

description:
My girlfriend and I were visiting San Francisco for the NIKE Half Marathon 10/19/14 & we wanted to watch The Broncos & 49ers game.  So we found this place online. Food is absolutely awful  ( we had nachos )
My main complaint is that my girlfriend ordered 3 bloody mary's ( one a regular & the other two were doubles ) well when the bill came they charged $11, $20 & $20 for what we thought was well vodka,  well guess what they supposedly made them with top shelf vodka  ( the waitress never told us that ) so for a dive sports bar I thought it was way high!!! Now for the kicker I was drinking my beer when I felt something tickle my neck by my Broncos Jersey I thought it was my girlfriend,  well low & behold it was a cockroach  ( can you believe that??? ) so do yourself a favor and stay clear of this place.
author: David A.

description:
Fun to be during big sports events! Was there for World Cup final, the atmosphere was absorbing. About 20-30 TV in the bar. 
Drinks are not so good...but understandable.
author: Bing G.

description: Came here to watch the last Giant's game last Tuesday  against the Cubs. Bar was packed, and was cranky due to the outcome of the game...but the cocktail waitress was always on top of her job. What should have been a crummy night was turned around by the cocktail girl. Great bar to watch a game, and even greater service.
author: Kevin D.

description: Great staff, lots of TVs, kind of gross bathrooms, reminds me of the The Alibi from Shameless.
author: Kyle N.

description:
This was the second stop on our search for a place to watch football games. We came in to a packed bar. There were tables available but no seating. How is that even possible? 

Its Sunday and the guys ordered some beers only to find out they were sold out of beer, even the bad beer. So they went for the worst type of beer. 

Even after finding patrons who would buy their crappy beer, they forgot about them. One of them had to go remind them that hey we ordered hella long ago.

The place was dim and the atmosphere felt crowded even though there were tables just no chairs. I wouldn't go back again!
author: Sheena D.

description:
2 people working for 70+ guests
Wreaks of cigarette/weed smoke 
Took 20 mins to close one tab

Plain and simple
author: Sam R.

description: A solid divey sports bar, no frills.  Decent selection of beer on draft, enough TVs, plenty of places to sit.  A good place to just hang out with friends and grab a few beers.
author: Kay C.

description:
Show all the UEFA Champions League games and willingly spent a lot of time trying to make sure they got next day's game of interest to me too. Switched to other games on demand. Closed caption for commentary, audio only for one game. 

They don't serve much food but you can bring your own from a restaurant of your choice.
author: Joakim S.

description:
Hmm, when all else fails, at least the pretty bartender chick hit on me ^_^

Met up with two strange men here, cause I was trying to be open-minded and make new friends...........yeah, then quickly realized why I don't have any friends lmao. 

I'm a smug bitch, I am content with the 2 friends I have. Fuck I need to make new friends for? I'm a grown ass woman, stuck in my ways. 

Anyway, I meet these two dudes and they're alright. Random small talk (you all should know how much I despise it!!!). Said I was leaving after a drink cause I had to do laundry....I stayed for 3. 

An awkward end to an awkward encounter lmao.....if anyone else is looking for a safe place to meetup with strangers this is it! The tenderloin is always a great place to meet people...haha. No, just kidding. You'll die or leave with a new addiction. 

Save yourself! 


But really, this place is massive and has enormous tvs and a couple pool tables. Cheap drinks and not too noisy. Bathrooms are okay and service was decent.
author: Lydia L.

description:
I just HAVE to give this place a good review for two reasons.

The first is that without fail, this is the only sports bar in my area that shows just about every football game on Sunday afternoons. If you're looking for a game that isn't nationally televised or is a bit more obscure, chances are this bar will have it on. (It strikes me as odd that there aren't more impressive sports bars in this area, but you've got to work with what you've got).

The second is that the bar staff is great. They are polite and attentive, even under pressure, and, as is the case with any bar, if you treat them well they will go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable.

Sure, the place is kind of a dive. Yes, with game days as an exception, it is definitely lacking in ambiance.

But it is a solid bet for a convenient, friendly place to watch the game.
author: Sara D.

description: Not sure if they had the heater on but the temp was well above 80 at 11:30 @ night. Service was good but it came from a doorman that smelled of weed and a bartender who needed some help. Not saying the doorman had a little smoke but he was around someone who had and the smell was ripe. Not uncommon in SF but that along with the hot box environment had me looking for another dive bar.
author: Jason B.

description: Ehhhhh it's alright. We came here cuz the hubs wanted to watch hockey which they were able to accommodate since they had the sports package and cold beer. So 2 stars for that. Other than that this place was poorly ventilated meaning hot as hell, smelled like a dirty kitchen, and had a random microwave in the bar with coffee supplies on top of it. Robert from Restaurant Impossible desperately needs to give this place a makeover.
author: Mimi A.

description:
I used to like this place, but will NEVER go back again. Watch out for overly aggressive bartender who will scoop up the money that you have on the bar next to your drink, plus the tip money. I guess he figures that when people have had a few drinks they won't notice. I did! The tip money is that which is placed on the edge of the bar close to the bartender. 

For the older guy tending bar, if you don't want people playing a certain kind of music, you should post a sign stating this. With his little button behind the bar, he advanced through all the songs I paid for!
author: Michael F.

description:
It's a bar. 
There's nothing special or clean about it. 
We went here because it was Sunday and being native Houstonians, we had to show our support for our Texans. The door guy didn't give us a hard time and was nice enough to switch one of the TVs on to the game for us since no one else in the bar gave a damn about Houston but cared enough to watch the Miami Dolphins? Ok, enough. We had to walk alllllll the way to the back of the bar to find seating, and this wasn't accompanied by every single pair of eyes on us and our Texans gear. It was as if the music came to a complete stop, all conversation was interrupted, and we were two outlaws being spotted. I feared for my life, but it's for the love of the game. I was able to get a pitcher of Dos Equis for $16, watch the Texans dominate the Colts and get out of there alive.
author: Victoria T.

description:
This place is perfect to have a drink and watch a game.  There are like 20 HDTVs all about 40 inch screens.  The bartenders are very friendly and definitely trying to work their charm to get that extra tip if you know what I mean.  I'm not a big fan of watching sports at a bar, but this place was not too bad.  It was pretty fun and I'll go to this place over any other bar that I'm familiar with.

the Great,
GumZ
author: David C.

description: impressive array of screens!...completely surrounded!...pride fight, hockey, basketball and more...six pm, and mostly suits and ties...a pair shooting pool in the back...self seated by red brick walls...waiting and waiting....single server working the entire busy room...guinness requested, but forgotten...an apology and finally delivered...$four pint of guinness...watching the bloody pride fights...
author: Hen A.

description:
USED to frequent the old Union Square Sports Bar on O'Farrell. The place had two outstanding bartenders in Christina and Angie back in the mid-to late 2000s.
If those girls are still serving drinks somewhere, I'd be there in a flash! Great times and great service!
author: Kieran I.

description:
This became one of My favorite bars in the City very quickly. I can catch up on all sporting events here cause of the 12 or si Flat screens and listen to some Dope Tunes simultaneously. 

However the Main reason I kept coming Back was because of the Bartenders. Apperantly they all migrated from a former Bar nearby and are skme of the Coolest chicks around. 

My favorite was Ashley "the Irish Gal," she was my first ever Personal Bartender, great for many reasons, Im gonna miss you Girl. SF will also.
author: Daryl N.

description:
For me, this place is really a 3 but on Super Bowl Sunday, it was a 5+!  After arriving to another place where we had a reservation to watch the game only to find out they gave away our table when the game started, we were in survival mode to find a comfortable place to watch the game. Insert our short walk here!  Union Square Sports Bar was first come first serve so at 11:45AM, there was plenty of space.  The place is BYOF since they don't serve any, which meant that we were able to order thai delivery for lunch and pizza and wings for dinner - win. win.

Also, the gals working on super bowl sunday were nothing but sweet the entire time and did a great job keeping the drinks flowing.  

Thanks Union Square Sports Bar for the great time!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
It's not the best bar I've ever been to, but it does the job. This bar is like a 2d rate football team that you watch because you live in a crappy town like Baltimore or Buffalo, and there's nothing else to do. This bar is the 6 of drunken sorority girls at a college party. She's not the cutest thing, but she'll go home with you.

You've got a bar, and you've got a lot of big screen TVs. You've got a sports bar! Very generic. The TVs on the wall opposite the bar were not functional on my last visit.

Because of the proximity to the 'loin, you occasionally get some thuggish-ruggish types inside. The security does a good job keeping them at the door, but be forewarned.

Bartenders seem to have been chosen more for looks than talent. It's a sports bar, so OK. But beware the dying keg; and inexperienced bar tender handling one of these managed to spray my friend with beer a few times in one night. Free beers on the deal, but still ...
author: Wes T.

description: This is your general sports bar. It's big, open, lots of big screen TVs, and a long bar with every kind of mid range alcohol you could possibly think of. It was a geographically made choice to go there before a concert at the Warfield. When I ordered, the bartender made it clear that she didn't want to have to go down to the basement to retrieve a fresh bottle for my drink, so I changed my order. The drink was just fine, although kind of expensive for a sports bar, in the Tenderloin.
author: Rachel D.

description:
Comfortable sports bar!

Insane number of TV's

Super friendly staff!!!

Decent prices

No food :(
author: Tony D.

description:
This place isn't fancy but its a pretty good place to watch a game. The staff was pretty friendly and walked around asking us if we needed anything. 

There are a lot of tvs to watch. The beer selection is good.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Visiting SF and don't know where to watch your favorite sports team play? In Downtown and want to catch a glimpse of a 49ers, Giants, Cal or Stanford game??

...Union Square Sports Bar to the rescue!! 

This place is perfect for watching a game of football, baseball, basketball, or whatever else you're looking for. The location of this bar is great, yet hidden enough that it could be easily over looked. U.S.S.B. (not to be mistaken for U.S.S.R.) is on Mason Street between Eddy and Ellis. From the heart of Union Square, you can get here in just a matter of minutes. What a perfect spot for the BFs/husbands to flock to while the GFs/wives go shopping! 

U.S.S.B. is your perfect sports bar. There are sooo many TVs here, making it extremely easy to watch a handful of games at a time. Due to my over-consumption of alcohol, I do not remember exactly, but I know there were definitely over 10 TVs mounted on walls throughout the bar. U.S.S.B. is appealing because it is not trashy, not ghetto, not dangerous and not too touristy. There are 2 pool tables in the back along with darts. 

I came here last week to celebrate Cal's victory against OSU (Go Golden Bears!) and to watch the 2nd half of the Stanford v. Oregon game. It was definitely filled with both Cardinal and Duck fans, but the crowd was behaved, which I appreciated. They had a great selection of beer and hard alcohol that kept my buzz going strong for hours. While I had a very entertaining night at the U.S.S.B., spending about 6 hours getting hammered (unintentionally) in there did leave me a bit traumatized and it may take some time before I think about returning there anytime soon... =P
author: Mari S.

description: Tried out this sports bar with a couple friends to watch some college football. We had a great time thanks for the great service and incredible number of televisions. The only reason this isn't a 5 star review is because the food was just above average.
author: Sean B.

description: Good bar, plays games along w the sound of the game- not just random music. Cheap beer- Blue Moon $4. Cons: slow service but friendly.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Nice place to stop and have a drink and watch a game.  But not sure if they have AIR but it is hot inside the bar.
author: David M.

description:
I went to the Union Square Sports Bar a few times when I was in town for a convention at Moscone.  Its not right on Union Square or exactly on Market Street but if you don't mind going slightly off the main tourist areas its a solid place to deflate from your day.

They had quite a few beers on tap.  There were plenty of cheap beers and a few craft type beers to choose from.  I believe they also had a selection of bottled beers to choose from.  There's a full bar also with all your liquor selections.  The prices on everything was affordable compared to the bar you'll find in your hotel or in the nicer full service restaurants in town.

The most important feature was the many many TV's they had available to watch all sorts of sports on.  The whole area above the bar is lined with TV's as is the area around the pool tables in addition to a spattering of TV's around the back walls of the restaurant.

There is no kitchen so don't expect much in the way of food.  The bartender made me a hotlink sausage on a bun.  This was all accomplished via a bun warmer and microwave on the back of the bar.  Pair that with your choice from the small bags of potato chips they have and you have a solid meal.  Anything more with your PBR would be quite pretentious.

Solid bar, great place to drink cheap beer and watch good sports.  Don't get taken at the hotel bars or fine dining bars.  Union Square Sports Bar is a much better choice.
author: Adam G.

description: Sat in the near-empty bar for 20minutes while the bar tender flirted with the newly-off-duty waitress. Getting laid is a higher priority than doing one's job.
author: Nick H.

description: Great vibe, not the fanciest neighborhood but it's near everywhere, if you're into sports and watching the game of the moment you will not be disappointed , screens everywhere, pool table and a good selection of beer and alcohol I'm only giving 4 instead of 5 stars because the bathroom ( girls ) is a little nasty and sometimes this druggies from around the corner manage to come in , but overall great experience
author: Katy B.

description: Here is the deal. If your used to the jock sports bar with start up guys in their collar shirts and slacks this may not be your bar. Here you will be sitting next to lady of the night, the international traveler and the  local all in one  night. The bar is not trying to be something it's  not. Good service, decent drinks and that's it. Nothing more nothing less. Great place to catch the game with no one trying to show off their money. Great local bar. And no drama.   Don't let the area fool u. It's a chill spot.
author: Sanfran L.

description: A little divey but I've definitely been to worse bars. Very close to our hotel room so it was walking distance. Pool tables in the back, pretty clean restroom and our bartender was really friendly. I'd probably return to watch football.
author: Holly G.

description: Awesome workers, good place to play pool and watch sports. The vibe is just right
author: Amy R.

description:
I am here more often than I care to admit. I love the bartenders, and for the most part, the other people I often find myself drinking with. Every so often the place can get a little ghetto, and definitely more than a little crowded on game days and weekends.

While they don't offer any food, they aren't going to stop you from bringing in your own. Huge selection on the jukebox, small but tasty selection of beers, and two pool tables.

The ONLY reason that this place isn't five stars...? My phone disappeared there once. Totally my fault, I left it unattended. Just realize the place is downtown and be smart about your possessions.
author: Taylor S.

description: Great Place to watch NFL sunday ticket. They don't serve food, but allow you to bring in anything that you have bought from outside. Drink prices were reasonable and they made a great effort to find seating for every patron that entered the bar on this Sunday afternoon. Next time I'm in Union Square on an NFL Sunday, I will be back to this establishment.
author: Travis A.

description: Decent sports bar to watch college football games on a Saturday afternoon. Kinda divey but simple is okay with me.
author: Amar T.

description:
i would like to live here.

thankfully, i actually do live 2 doors down from this place. which actually isn't a thing to be thankful for because i spent all my dolla dolla billz on beer and now i have no money.  

first world problems, but i'm glad they're mine. freakin love this place. adorable, friendly staff and great beers on tap. plus cider on tap for those nights when you just want to be a pansy. oh, and TV's galore! what's not to love?
author: Morgan H.

description:
Great location.  Close to shopping and hotels.  

Service is weird but they have a good pour.  Ended up charging us for drinks the people next to use had :(

Great place to watch the Diamondbacks win!!!
author: Brooks S.

description: This is the best place near Union Square to watch the Giants move towards another win. With clean bathrooms, and a great selection of cheap beer you can't really go wrong.
author: Cameron K.

description:
Was playing pool and a cockroach ran by my feet. Bf mentioned it to the bartender and his response was "Eh." 

Luckily I had four drinks in me so I forgot like two minutes later and kept playing pool. Bartender didn't pay much attention to customers but it was super slow anyways. And the last time I was there, one of the female waitresses or whatever was hella drunk and kept giving wrong change.
author: Heather M.

description: this place is great if you need drinks and dont wanna travel too far off the downtown strip. i came here on a Monday  night when happy hour was going on. i ordered 2 tequila sunrise and omg the worst drink ever i tasted... i mean i have had this drink before at other places but it was awful makes me not wanna go back again.  didnt even finish half of the drink cuz it was gross. srvice was ok the bartender did check up and etc. too bad i didnt ask for a new one im sure i could have gotten something better.
author: Alex T.

description:
What a wonderful find away, but not far from the hustle and bustle. A rowdy bar (that holiday night) found last year was replaced by a Chipolte. Good news we found it again. Although we had only been once to the previous location and it was totally packed, the new location was nicer on the inside than what I remembered and it seemed bigger. The location isn't right in the middle of things in Union Square but when the streets are crazy you can walk one more block and get away from the craziness. Just don't go too much further than the bar as it borders the tenderloin which can be a little iffy at times. I also liked that the bart stop was right down the block. We will go back. 

Also the bartender was great. She was very friendly and talkative. I love that in a bartender.
author: Dianne M.

description: I'm not a huge fan of the of this place. I've been here quite a few times, but am never truly excited to return - it's more of a forced return by friends who work around the area. In any event, I'll continue to frequent as I'm requested, but won't opt for this place as my first... or second, choice.
author: Noneya B.

description: Nothing special.  They actually charge for peanuts and bar snacks and the only "real" food they have is hot dogs.  I'd be ok with that if the drinks were something remarkable, but they aren't.  They have standard beer that you can find most anywhere in the bay area and there was just no life or spirit in the place.  I just feel like you can do a lot better at dozens of places within two blocks.  If all you want is a cold beer, some sports on TV, and maybe a game of darts, then this place is fine.  If you want anything to eat or something besides standard beer on tap and to have to pay for a tiny bag of pretzels or peanuts, then you can find much better.
author: Jim F.

description:
If you have the shits, do not go to this bar.  The doors don't lock, so you could find yourself in quite a predicament. 

Aside from that - Union Square Sports bar is a good option if you're in the neighborhood.  Plenty of TV's and a couple of pool tables too, when there is room.  Doesn't serve food, but they are cool with you bringing in anything you want to eat.  Cheap drinks, generally speaking which always helps.  Good service, too.

I took in a couple WS Giants games here and watched a lot of NBA there last year.  Crowd is always...  special!  The proximity to the 'loin may even mean you'll be accosted on your visit!   

Great spot for any sporting event.
author: Sean O.

description: $4 for a soda. Nope. I was really surprised when my bill came. The beer was $4.40 and a non alcoholic beverage was $4. Disappointed.
author: Sarah H.

description: It shouldn't even get a star. Worst service EVER!!!!! Blonde chick gets mad when you ask for a drink. She is more worried about her personal life and what is going on with her than that of the service of the patrons. Could be an amazing place. I come from New Orleans and I love smaller feel bars with football instead of the mainstream. This place has potential but with staff like her you are going to have a lot of disappointment. So horrible!!!
author: Cherish D.

description:
So I HAD to write a review about this place. My boss and I were in SF for business and we were trying to watch the LA Kings v the Boston Bruins hockey game. Apparently, most bars in SF's Union Square area don't carry the NHL package but Union Square Sports Bar did! This was the third bar we stopped by to see if they carried the game and were so happy to hear that this bar did. 
The bar is a pretty good size bar. I was there last Tuesday and there weren't many people in the bar. We got to sit right in front of one of the TVs and watch the game. 
I must disclose that this bar does not have food BUT as the cool bar tender mentioned, any restaurant around the area delivers...  So we did just that! We ordered from this one Indian place (sorry can't remember the name but it's the bar tender's favorite so he will be able to help you out with that one) and it was delicious. It looked kind of funny to be eating Indian food at a bar while watching a hockey game but who cares! lol So just for having that option, I would not take any stars away from this place.
author: Beldevina P.

description: So, I went in last night to watch the opening game of the NFL season. The tvs ate not huge but there are a lot of them so it was just fine for viewing purposes. The seating options are a little cramped but that is every bar so again not an issue. The issue came with the food. They only serve hot dogs and nachos, I like both of those things. I ordered the nachos and so did the person with me. These were the saddest nachos I have ever seen, ever. The chips are standard chips, the cheese is the fake nacho cheese, the chili is hornel's chili, diced onions to top it off. To be honest it was gross. The service was pretty slow as well, not the server's fault because she was the only one working. If you just want to get drunk at the bar, go for it. If you want food, or service do not go for it.
author: David K.

description: 17 TVs! We were cruising around Chinatown and Union Square and game time was quickly approaching. Found this little nook of a bar and slid right in. The beggars at the door were annoying but what can ya do. This place was just fine. Tons of TVs, good beer and rowdy 49ers Fans. Nothin fancy and I don't think they had any food so next stop would be Johnny Foleys.
author: Jenn K.

description:
My how a World Series can change a town . . . This place gets major points for convenience and ability to absorb a big crowd.  There are tons of TVs so you can see from wherever you're sitting (or standing, this week).  

I wrote off the sweltering temperature on my first visit as a side effect of the hoards of newly-minted Giants fans that had packed in.  But on visit number two I got there early to save seats for my friends, and it was not yet too crowded, yet still pushing 90 degrees.  So, wear a tank top and leave your panda hat at home, but otherwise it's a great place to meet your friends after work.
author: Elisabeth D.

description: Kind of a hole in the wall but they have every game, great beer, and a lively crowd. What else do you want out of a sports bar?
author: Grayson W.

description: No food served. Well, they do serve hot dogs, but that's all. How do you sit through a three hour game just eating crappy joy dogs. Go elsewhere.
author: Tim M.

description: A large group of us came here to watch the NBA game, but I was also watching the Kings game and the San Fran game so I was pretty happy to have so many TVS to choose from. I thought the place was pretty chill. Noise level was low, the environment was relaxed, but there were zero other girls here, other than our group, the drinks were kinda pricey, but not bad, just stinks there was no happy hour on Sunday. The bartender was kinda rude. I can't say she was rude but maybe just lacking communication skills. Downside here is that they do not serve food at all. You can get food and bring it in, which we did. We went to the taqueria down the street, and it was really good, but you cannot bring drinks in and it sucked because we had a delicious and huge horchata we wanted to drink. Overall, this place is ok, and affordable and easy for larger groups, but maybe for food and a more fun environment, I would go somewhere else.
author: Heather Lynn H.

description: Not just a dive bar, but a sports bar filled with good people and great drinks.  How can you not love this place!
author: Kenneth G.

description:
Stopped here on the way to Vessel after we left the 21 Club when the guy that sat next to us smelled really bad.

The bartender was super friendly and the prices where decent.  We had a couple beers and some Jim Beam and took off for some sick house.

Obviously they have a bunch of TVs so if you're into sports you'll get your fix here.
author: Jason S.

description: I came here on a friday night at around 1am, which is weird for a sports bar being open so late. But the place is nice and clean, but the service was horrible. The bartender took forever to get us our drinks and they sell peanuts by the bag. Very sketchy area of course, but which part of frisco isn't at 1 in the morning? Lots of tv's to watch games, and plenty of room to sit
author: Phan H.

description: I watched the Packers-Steelers game here yesterday because I don't have cable. It was very pleasant. A bit loud, but, hey, it's a sports bar. The bartenders were fabulous. My bloody marys and mimosas cost $6 each, which is great. I had a seat at the bar and everyone was friendly and nice. I only wish they served food ... more than hot dogs, that is.
author: Kim C.

description:
Went to USSB last Thursday to watch the Lakers handle business in Game 4 of the Finals.  Picked the place because of its close location to our hotel and the Yelp reviews.  

Aside from the Laker haters, I liked the vibe at this place. 

Pabst tall boys are money!
author: Jason L.

description: Really friendly service and cheap drinks for union square. Fun place to watch a game.
author: Mike F.

description: Good bar, they have the nba TV channel so I was able to catch the blazer games. Beers are five dollars and the only downfall about this bar is they don't have any food.
author: Kyle A.

description:
Back in the old days you could sit outside this place, drink a few Barley Pops and enjoy the scenery.  I used to kick it with my boy and the local bookie, as well as low level la costa nostra soldier Lucky and former boxer and special person Robert Ali.  The Tiger Woods lookalike bar tender was a cool dude and a female bar tender or two had some loving time with my boy.  
Anyway, my friend and I visited recently at the new location and this place sucks.  The bar tenders during the day shift anyway are rude a-holes.  Pardon me for calling European football, soccer.  Last time I checked this was America.  One guy was put out that I asked if he had a Pyramid Hefi on tap.  Isn't that his job?  
This place is over-priced big time and some of the rudest jackwipes I've ever met.  I was good for 100 a night when I was on a roll and now I promise you that 100 is going somewhere else.  
To bad, this place used to be my favorite place in the TL.  Now by far the worst.  Oh and by the way, clean the friggin' dumpers.  I don't like wading in someone's urine to use the bathroom.  Filthy.
author: TJ B.

description:
SAID was the super nice & courtesy bartender. He turned on the game for me.  gave awesome service. WONDERFUL & tasty watermelon Long Island Iced tea!!  & a bountiful glass(es) o' chard - @ HH prices.  They have preztels.

You MUST go!!
author: X M.

description: Good place. No food. Was there for a hockey game, but Stanfords football team was playing so obviously hockey got put on the back burner. No sound. But clean place, pool tables, hotdogs and pretzels. But food can be delivered.
author: Ashley S.

description:
It's a nice place to watch sports, although I would imagine it can get very packed. 

The drinks are O.K. They have a decent selection on tap and relatively a full bar. Bartenders are a bit absent. If they are flirting with some guy, it can take a while to get a drink, and as far as food goes, they only serve hot dogs.

Then again, it's a sports bar, so what else can you want?
author: Yelena K.

description:
USSB is a solid joint.  I like the bartenders a lot.  They are all cool and make the place worth going to.  The drawback of the spot is the location.  It's TL which is fine but for some reason the USSB draws a different crowd than most TL dive bars.  Therefore it's not really a dive but it is more of a destination for Divey people, which maybe why I go there.

Not really sure...
author: Anthony Y.

description: Came to this place 12/21.  First thing I noticed was this place has a ton of LCD Tv's for the sports games.  Had a good selection of beer and the bartender was really friendly.  Would come to again if I was in union square
author: Tyler M.

description: This place is ok, nothing special.  They have a lot of TV's and an ok selection of beer.  I would give in one more star but the wait staff isn't worthy.  I sat there with an empty glass for almost ten minutes while one bartender played on her phone and the other ate her sandwich. This bar just seemed to lack personality.
author: Todd R.

description:
great bar with plenty of flat screens on every wall and a very nice bartender. we enjoyed a Sunday afternoon after a little shopping in the city having a few beers. I suggest trying the blue moon with a splash of OJ. the bartender suggested it and it was a nice twist from a orange slice.
The only downside is the collection of bums on every corner leading up to the bar. But i guess that is to be expected when in that part of SF.
author: Jason S.

description: Lots of beers on draft - no craft beers, but a solid selection. Lots of tv's. No food, but they have chips and hot links and will let you bring in take out. It's a solid spot to watch a few games after work.
author: Michelle W.

description:
Went on a Sat night. Good place to catch whatever game you may be looking for - there are enough tv's that pretty much everything is on.  Good music playing too.  They don't serve food (except hot dogs which I didn't try) but you can bring food in.  There's a pizza place around the corner that does pretty good slices.

The crowd is definitely a mix of people - everyone from college kids to the local drug addicts.  A friendly mix though - the place has a good vibe.

The bartender, Chelsea, was fantastic.  Personable, on top of everything.
author: James C.

description: When in SF and going to The Warfield or staying in Hotel next door this is a great place to hang out. Very good service  a bit of a dive bar which i like... its in the Tenderloin so the area is not that great at night but this bar is the exception. Great place.. great drinks..friendly
author: Mark A.

description: Perfect location right by the Powell BART. Great seating options at the bar, or high tables, and tons of standing room.  Tons of TVs! Drinks are reasonably priced. Staff is very friendly. Went for the All Star events on a Saturday evening and it wasnt too busy, but enough people to get excited about the game. Also, they have a really nice restroom for a bar. Only one occupant at a time though.
author: J. M.

description: Not sure what the appeal is here, beyond the good amount of HD TVs that actually show proper HD broadcasts (unlike some bars that stretch non-HD feeds). Very dingy and divey with beer neon overkill. Even the pool tables weren't adequately lit. For what it's worth, they did show the Dodgers game, which I thought was sacrilege here in SF...
author: Maximillian M.

description: So my co-worker (from Boston) and I were looking for a bar near his hotel (Marriott Marquis) after work and we walked around and happened to find this unassuming bar.  We saw "Sports Bar" on the awning and thought "why not?" so we went inside.  It's definitely a sports bar and we were there for Monday Night Football and just caught the tail end of happy hour.  I ordered a Blue Moon for me and a Fat Tire for him and they were $4 a piece.  As I was grabbing my glass to move to one of the tables, the bartender motions to me to let her grab my glass.  I'm wondering what she's going to do and she picks it up and says "let me top that off for you".  I thought that was amazing and told her I've NEVER had a bartender top off a beer once the head settled.  That was really cool and left a great impression on me - now when I'm in the area, I'll stop by for a drink or two.  They also have a couple of pool tables toward the back if your with some friends and want to kill some time over a couple of drinks.
author: Paul C.

description:
If you are in dire need to watch a sporting event and have NO other choices then try this place.

They have relocated and I have only been to the new location, which is only a few blocks from the old place.

Many tv's to watch the games. The beers are expensive. They have a jukebox and the bathroom is clean.

The big issue here is the service. I came to this place two days in a row and had two different bartenders and they were both awful. Both of them were angry, as if I was bothering them by asking for a beer.

After paying $6 for my pint and leaving a $1 tip, I didn't receive a thank you, a smile or any sort of acknowledgement that I was a human being/paying customer that was standing two feet from them.

On the second day that I was there, a guy came in and met a friend of his at the table next to me. They were talking for a few minutes and he got my attention and asked me if I had ever been there before and what I thought about the girl behind the bar. I mentioned that she had been a  b***h since the minute I walked in there and that every time I ordered a beer it was like pulling teeth.    

So he starts to tell me and his friend that she is the owners daughter and that she's a notorious jerk. He said to us, "watch, I bet she'll have me kicked out in the next few minutes because I haven't ordered anything". 

I chuckled and went back to watching my hockey game and they continued catching up and lo and behold, 10 minutes later the door man comes up to this guy and says "hey man, i don't know why the girl behind the bar has it in for you but she says that if you don't order a drink that you have to get out".

Now it was a weekday afternoon and the place had MAYBE 15 people in it. So the guy explains to the bouncer that he was out jogging, got a text from his friend to come by to say hello and that they were just catching up. (His friend was drinking, btw).

The doorman says, "that doesn't matter, if she wants you out then you have to go". So the guy looks over at me and gives me that "i told you so" kind of look and him and his buddy walk out.

My game ended and I decided to go and I caught up with these guys outside and the guy who got kicked out said that he's seen it happen before.

He goes, "the service is horrible, most of the girls behind the bar are angry and incompetent. sometimes they get around to serving you after you wait for ten minutes at the bar looking to buy a drink. at other times, as you just witnessed, they'll throw you out for being there ten minutes and NOT ordering a drink."

He went on to say that he hates the place and I can see exactly why. It's too bad that the bitchy bartender I ran into on day 2 is the owners daughter, so she isn't going anywhere.

I'm not sure what she's looking for as a tip on a $6 beer, but apparently $1 makes her angry.

Here's a suggestion sister, you might make more money in tips with a smile and a "thank you" to your CUSTOMERS, instead of your angry routine that you seem to prefer.
author: Paddy O.

description: TONS of tv's and great staff.  great beer selection as well.  there's really nothing too special but it makes for a great place to watch sports.  they'll put any game you want on any tv.
author: Scott N.

description: I read the reviews before going to this bar to see the SEC championship game. The 2 bartenders were not polite at all... and that is being kind. They had chips on their shoulders. They were rude. My first Guiness was great, the second from the tap was poured into a round glass. A big no no for anyone with any knowledge of Guiness. After 1.25 glasses of Guiness and 1.5 hours at the establishment, I was told I could not be there with my dog. My dog is a service animal, registered with the city of SF. My dog was not barking or being obnoxious. Boycott this place!! I will be filing a formal complaint against this bar on Monday with Animal care and control of SF. They broke a federal law. Upon telling them that it was against the law to deny services to a service dog, one of the bartenders asked me where my dogs vest was. I told her my dog does not have to be singled out. I even showed her my dogs assistance animal tag. I informed her she was breaking the law, but she did not care. I'm awaiting a written and verbal apology from the 2 bartenders, one a manager. The bouncer was friendly and knew the girls were wrong. When I get the written apology, I will post it under images and my request for boycott will be lifted.
author: Kimber C.

description: My daughter and future son-in-law were in town over the weekend and we decided to stop for a drink to catch the Olympics. While not a fancy bar, the drinks were well priced, service good and plenty of screens to watch all the events.
author: Paul M.

description: Basically as advertised. Neighborhood bar with lots of TV's showing lots of games. The downside is that no food is served.
author: Ted D.

description: Been to SF many times but this time brought some friends from NM who happened to be in town for SB weekend.  The bar was located about a block from our hotel (Hilton) in Union Square.  Ashley ROCKED!! She was the only server when the Super Bowl game started, the place was packed and she was taking care of everyone - getting drinks, maneuvering through the crowd, dealing w/ touchy feely customers, and did this without getting stressed out - that girl was ON IT!!  Impressive!!!  Frankie & Brian were behind the bar taking care of business on that end and then Jaime (sp?) showed up later on to help out - This crew seriously kicks ass!!!  We went in on Sat. night to check out the place, do some recon to see if would be a cool place to watch the big game - Jaime was working that night and gave us some good tips, super cool chick!, the bouncer guy (didn't catch his name) was super chill hanging out by the door doing his thing...All around a great atmosphere.  Lots of TV's mounted, not a bad seat in the house at all.  No price gouging, when we were there they had a few drink specials which were reasonable.  They don't have food - except they did say they had hot dogs? - but they let you bring food in from outside.  That's awesome!  They told us about a few pizza places that delivered so we ordered delivery.  Kinda neat to be watching the game, eating pizza w/ our big pizza box right there at our table.  After the game we stuck around for a bit, crowd started to thin out, so we got to talk to w/ Brian outside while taking a smoke break, also w/ Ashley when we were out taking another smoke break LOL Jaime recognized us right away and came over to chat w/ us - like I said that girl was way cool.  Same w/ Ashley - we were super impressed w/ the way she handled the work load by herself till Jaime showed up, very very nice girl.  SF is a great place to visit, we will def be coming back and will be stopping by again to see what's up w/ these peeps!!
author: Miss L.

description: I came here to watch the Giants play game 3 of the NLCS.   Bartender was quick with the drinks and hotdog.  I'll be back to watch a game and have a drink.
author: Roger W.

description: I love this place and have been going there for at least a decade between the two locations. The service is great and the drinks are great. Even when "Blondezilla," (and you will know her when you meet her.) is on a cranky self centered rampage acting like she could care less if you rolled over and died, is doing her thing the place still feels like the spot to get sauced at before or after any special occasion. For the record too the wonderful and drop dead gorgeous "Beth" to whom you should pay homage to and tip heavily like you would the rest of the awesome ladies there is not the above stated "Blondezilla," She unfortunately has moved on to greener pastures and is knocking over buildings and old ladies in her spare time else where. Rest assured though that her legend lives on in the hearts of many a bad review. Now that the hours are back to normal and the pool tables are still crooked, it's all good. I love that place and so do what's left of my liver and kidneys...
author: Muhammad R.

description: this place fails in every facet. they call themselves a "sports bar" but they don't carry the NHL package? sure, one might say, this is CALIFORNIA and it's just another Canadian trying to push hockey on the Americans, BUT the Bay Area has an NHL team 50 miles south of here who are pretty damn good and who sell out on a pretty regular basis. PLUS, there are other bars in SF who do not have the words "sports bar" in their title who carry the NHL package and who regularly show NHL games. also, on a side note, your punching bag arcade game is gonna kill someone soon...I witnessed a friend split his head open playing it, but then again, he probably should not have done multiple tequila shots before playing said game
author: James J.

description: This is by far the best sports bar in the city! I highly recommend it for any sporting event. I will definitely be there Sunday for the World Cup final!
author: Jen G.

description: Only spot downtown to get any sport on the tube (hard to get NHL games, my personal preference), so this place is great. Only other places that show NHL in the city are Green's (grudgingly), Kilowatt and Mad Dog.
author: Danny C.

description: first thing...the place is loud.  larger bar with a long bar top and probably 20 stools.  black wooden bartop with a classic wood rail, good footrest too.  the bar stools along the bar have backs.  on the right side and down the center are multiple high tables with diner-esqe stools.  two pool tables in the rear.  24-ounce pabst for $4 is hard to beat, plus they have multiple beers on tap.  fairly well lit with lights, neon signs, and maybe 12 42" hdtvs.  no food expect hot dogs, but pizza, indian, etc. is easily delivered.  calm patrons, but you get a straggler every now and than, but the bartender is quick to kick them out.  brick interior is nice and the bar back is huge...mostly tvs and directv recievers, but the bar shelves are filled with tons of top shelf and bottom shelf liquors.  in many places i leave my cash on the bar and let the bartender make change, i wouldnt do that here after seeing him "short-change" a couple people while sitting at the bar so make sure you get/count your change.
author: D h.

description: Lovely.  I sure love paying six dollars for a friggin bear.  Yeah, the bartender has a sweet caboose and a set of chompers, but hell that is a lot of money for a beer.  The jukebox is nice I guess if you like listening to Paula Abdul and Tito Jackson.  The food is nonexistent.  Well there's food in the shatty, but that's another story.  I could live with all of that but the bums outside kill me.  I pay six dollars for a beer and ten for a mixed drink and it burns me but I could handle it if the bums weren't there.  The sports memorbillia on the wall is terrible.  Try putting some Joe D up there.  For crying loud, who the hell is Pele'?  The Brazilian piece of crap who sucked it up with the NY Cosmos back in the day.  Get with it folks.  Hell, I could handle Mary Lou Retton's tight bummer up there over Pele's leather looking mug.  Get with it USSB or I'll stop coming there four times a week.  Try two dollar beers on Sundays and Mondays chief.
author: TJ R.

description: rediculous number of tv's with every game possible.  huge space.  pool tables.  no snobs.  great beer selection.  what's not to love?
author: DG G.
